question.body: There is a proverb that “blood is thicker than water.” Is blood more dense than water?

multiple_choice.choice: blood is more dense than water
blood is less dense than water

response.feedback: Correct. The specific gravity of blood is 1.020 which is more dense than water.
Incorrect. Blood is more dense than water because of the cells and other dense components.
Incorrect. Blood is more dense than water from the cellular materials.
